feature.name: Druid Circle: Circle of the Griffon (HB)
feature.text:
This druid is a warrior that protects nature. They are trained to guard the wilderness and stand their ground against evil.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Circle Spells (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
When you reach certain Druid levels, you gain access to the spells listed below. They count as Druid spells for you, and you always have them prepared, but they don't count against the number of spells you prepare each day.
Circle of the Griffon Spells: Druid Level | Circle Spells 2nd | cure wounds, thunderwave 3rd | barkskin, flame blade 5th | call lightning, dispel magic 7th | blight, wall of fire 9th | mass cure wounds, wall of stone
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Fighting Style (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.
(You can find a list of all fighting styles in ‘Feats’)
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Fighting Style: Archery (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Fighting Style: Dueling (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Fighting Style: Two-Weapon Fighting (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Unarmed Fighting (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit. At the start of each of your turns, you deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Elemental Resistance (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
You are resistant to two of the following damage types: cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Extra Attack (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
You can attack twice with a melee or ranged weapon.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Griffon Shape (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
You are able to wild shape into a griffon as part of your Wild Shape feature.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Evasion (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Superior Critical (Circle of the Griffon (HB))
feature.text:
Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.
Source: Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (Homebrew)
